actions.args: {"body": {"name": "Travel Stipend [Redacted] Bangkok, Nov. 2024 ", "summary": "I am an AI developer who worked on a PoC project implementing an AI model for the Hana Bank app in South Korea. Recently, I won the Nillion Bounty track at the BeWater x NEAR HZN AI Alpha Hackathon by developing a blind app on Nillion TestNet to protect AI model training data for face anti-spoofing. This experience deepened my commitment to merging blockchain and AI. At the Redacted Hackathon, I aim to showcase blockchain-AI solutions and engage with the NEAR ecosystem.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": null, "description": "Project: Ludium\\\\u{2019}s Web3 Builder Bounty Platform\\\\nDetails: A platform where sponsors create bounties for community members to apply, submit results, and receive rewards. The project will feature algorithm-based builder profile analysis, team matching, and a multichain settlement feature via Chain Abstraction.\\\\nProject link: \\\\nhttps://devpost.com/software/ludium-web3-career-pathfinder\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nTravel Plan & Costs\\\\n\\\\nFlight:\\\\nDescription: Round trip flight from Seoul, South Korea, to Bangkok, Thailand\\\\nCost: $300\\\\n\\\\nAccommodation:\\\\nDescription: 3-night stay from November 8-11\\\\nCost: $200\\\\nTotal Cost: $500", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "tchoi617.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "500", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Hackathon", "Travel expenses"], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 131680622}

{"data": {"events-committee.near": {"post": {"main": "{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"text\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"We have just received a new *Bounty* proposal.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**By**: @tchoi617.near\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Title**: \\\\u{201c}Travel Stipend [Redacted] Bangkok, Nov. 2024 \\\\u{201c}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Summary**:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nI am an AI developer who worked on a PoC project implementing an AI model for the Hana Bank app in South Korea. Recently, I won the Nillion Bounty track at the BeWater x NEAR HZN AI Alpha Hackathon by developing a blind app on Nillion TestNet to protect AI model training data for face anti-spoofing. This experience deepened my commitment to merging blockchain and AI. At the Redacted Hackathon, I aim to showcase blockchain-AI solutions and engage with the NEAR ecosystem.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nRead the full proposal and share your feedback on [DevHub](/events-committee.near/widget/app?page=proposal&id=119)\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}"}}}}

{"proposal": {"id": 119, "snapshot": {"name": "Travel Stipend [Redacted] Bangkok, Nov. 2024 ", "labels": ["Hackathon", "Travel expenses"], "summary": "I am an AI developer who worked on a PoC project implementing an AI model for the Hana Bank app in South Korea. Recently, I won the Nillion Bounty track at the BeWater x NEAR HZN AI Alpha Hackathon by developing a blind app on Nillion TestNet to protect AI model training data for face anti-spoofing. This experience deepened my commitment to merging blockchain and AI. At the Redacted Hackathon, I aim to showcase blockchain-AI solutions and engage with the NEAR ecosystem.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "editor_id": "tchoi617.near", "timestamp": "1730435613505419782", "supervisor": null, "description": "Project: Ludium\\\\u{2019}s Web3 Builder Bounty Platform\\\\nDetails: A platform where sponsors create bounties for community members to apply, submit results, and receive rewards. The project will feature algorithm-based builder profile analysis, team matching, and a multichain settlement feature via Chain Abstraction.\\\\nProject link: \\\\nhttps://devpost.com/software/ludium-web3-career-pathfinder\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nTravel Plan & Costs\\\\n\\\\nFlight:\\\\nDescription: Round trip flight from Seoul, South Korea, to Bangkok, Thailand\\\\nCost: $300\\\\n\\\\nAccommodation:\\\\nDescription: 3-night stay from November 8-11\\\\nCost: $200\\\\nTotal Cost: $500", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "tchoi617.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "500", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "author_id": "tchoi617.near", "snapshot_history": [], "social_db_post_block_height": "0"}}

{"body": {"name": "Travel grant for ETHBangkok", "summary": "Hello! I\\\\\\'m a software developer who participated in the Redacted hackathon, where I developed an innovative proof of concept using NFC ISO14443 technology on the NEAR blockchain. The project enables users to make seamless, contactless money transfers between two mobile devices, leveraging Host Card Emulation (HCE) and NFC reader technology. Our proof of concept was successfully submitted by the hackathon deadline. This project addresses the growing demand for secure and accessible payment soluti", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": null, "description": "At ETHWarsaw, I developed the initial version of this project, creating a simple protocol that enabled money transfers between a mobile device and a computer using a USB NFC adapter. Since then, I significantly enhanced the project at the Redacted hackathon. I redesigned the protocol to support mobile-to-mobile transfers, introducing NFC ISO14443 compatibility and custom APDU (Application Protocol Data Unit) hexadecimal commands for secure information exchange between two phones.\\\\n\\\\nImplementing the ISO14443 protocol proved challenging, especially with limited documentation and proprietary aspects of NFC technology. For instance, achieving secure authentication between the two devices involved configuring complex hexadecimal commands, which allow the phones to authenticate and initiate data transfer securely. Overcoming these issues required extensive research and experimentation to ensure reliable and secure communications on NEAR\\\\u{2019}s blockchain.\\\\n\\\\nProposed Timeline & Milestones\\\\nMilestone 1: Complete the protocol + add FIAT transactions, summarizing insights into implementing the NFC ISO14443 standard on the NEAR chain (2 weeks).\\\\nMilestone 2: Develop and test cross-platform compatibility for Android and iOS, ensuring broader access (4 weeks).\\\\nMilestone 3: Refine security features by implementing advanced authentication measures and data encryption for increased transaction safety (3 weeks).\\\\nTeam Background\\\\nI\\\\u{2019}m an experienced software developer with a background in blockchain and IoT, and I have a deep commitment to pioneering contactless technology on NEAR. I also bring experience from other hackathons where I\\\\u{2019}ve developed similar PoCs, enabling me to iterate and build upon this innovative NFC solution effectively.\\\\n\\\\nFund Allocation\\\\nTravel and Accommodation: X% \\\\u{2013} Attendance at ETHBangkok will help showcase the project, gather community feedback, and collaborate with NEAR developers to drive further improvements.\\\\nDevelopment and Testing: 100% - X% \\\\u{2013} Resources to test and enhance platform compatibility and security, Hardware and Tools, Documentation.\\\\n\\\\nThis funding will help me not only refine the project but also share my learnings with the NEAR community, making NFC-based payments more accessible for Web3 applications and ultimately driving adoption of the NEAR protocol.\\\\n\\\\nhttps://github.com/albertoZurini/ETHWarsaw2024\\\\nhttps://github.com/albertoZurini/redacted2024/tree/master", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "743ccc68311c87ff4c608dd95fb15c6d05f4d9fed4f4d3c78d5e4fdc4d3cda2a", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "1000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Travel expenses", "Hackbox"], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 131713042}

I also bring experience from other hackathons where I\\\\u{2019}ve developed similar PoCs, enabling me to iterate and build upon this innovative NFC solution effectively.\\\\n\\\\nFund Allocation\\\\nTravel and Accommodation: X% \\\\u{2013} Attendance at ETHBangkok will help showcase the project, gather community feedback, and collaborate with NEAR developers to drive further improvements.\\\\nDevelopment and Testing: 100% - X% \\\\u{2013} Resources to test and enhance platform compatibility and security, Hardware and Tools, Documentation.\\\\n\\\\nThis funding will help me not only refine the project but also share my learnings with the NEAR community, making NFC-based payments more accessible for Web3 applications and ultimately driving adoption of the NEAR protocol.\\\\n\\\\nhttps://github.com/albertoZurini/ETHWarsaw2024\\\\nhttps://github.com/albertoZurini/redacted2024/tree/master", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "743ccc68311c87ff4c608dd95fb15c6d05f4d9fed4f4d3c78d5e4fdc4d3cda2a", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "1000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "author_id": "743ccc68311c87ff4c608dd95fb15c6d05f4d9fed4f4d3c78d5e4fdc4d3cda2a", "snapshot_history": [], "social_db_post_block_height": "0"}}

{"id": 113, "body": {"name": "Red Flight Team => Travel Stipend [Redacted] - Bangkok, Nov. 2024", "summary": "Red Flight is an AI Red Teaming NFT Game developed on the NEAR Protocol. As a leading AI Security & Safety company, we\\\\\\'ve created a platform where users can conduct AI red teaming exercises, participate in bug bounties, and tokenize successful attack strategies as NFTs. We\\\\\\'re expanding our impact through strategic partnerships, having recently concluded discussions with Meta\\\\\\'s VP Boon regarding a collaborative red teaming event with Meta Korea, while also engaging with Erica Kang from NEAR.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": "yarotska.near", "description": "# Red Flight: AI Red Teaming NFT Gaming Platform\\\\n\\\\n## Overview\\\\nRed Flight is our innovative AI Red Teaming NFT Game built on the NEAR Protocol. We\\\\\\'ve created a unique platform where AI security testing meets blockchain gaming, allowing users to conduct red teaming exercises and monetize their findings through NFTs, all while contributing to global AI safety standards.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## AI Security Gaming Features\\\\nOur platform supports various security testing operations:\\\\n* AI Red Teaming\\\\n* Bug Bounty Programs\\\\n* Attack Data NFT Minting\\\\n* Security Strategy Trading through NFT trading\\\\n\\\\nMore Detail info : https://devpost.com/software/red-flight?ref_content=user-portfolio&ref_feature=in_progress\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## Request for Travel Stipend:\\\\nWe are seeking assistance with flights to Bangkok, which cost approximately $350 per person. We would also greatly appreciate staying at a NEAR Hackerhouse if available. And we request up to $200 per person for accommodation. \\\\n\\\\nDeparture: ICN, South Korea \\\\u{2192} Bangkok, Thailand\\\\n\\\\nReturn: Bangkok, Thailand \\\\u{2192} ICN, South Korea\\\\n\\\\n## Estimated breakdown:\\\\nFlight cost per person: $350\\\\nAccommodation cost per person: $200\\\\nTeam size: 2 \\\\nRequest per person: $500 \\\\nTotal: $1,000 \\\\nTotal request: $1,000\\\\n\\\\n## About Our Team\\\\nOur award-winning team brings expertise in:\\\\n* AI Security & Safety\\\\n* Blockchain Development\\\\n* Game Design\\\\nEvent Participants : \\\\nYoujun Lee : Software Developer / CPO\\\\nHaon Park : AI Hacker\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## Conclusion\\\\nRed Flight represents a significant advancement in AI security testing, combining the rigor of professional security assessment with the accessibility of gaming. By leveraging blockchain technology and NFTs, we\\\\\\'re creating a sustainable ecosystem that incentivizes and rewards contributions to AI safety.\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n*Best regards,*  \\\\n*Team Red Flight*\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [108], "receiver_account": "youjun.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "500", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDT"}, "labels": ["Meetup", "Hackathon", "Travel expenses"]}

{"id": 114, "body": {"name": "BuildLink team expenses for [REDICTED] HACKATHON Bangkok Nov 9 - 11", "summary": "Build Links is an innovative AI-Blockchain project developed on the NEAR Protocol, aimed at bridging Web3 and Web2 by enabling users to interact with blockchain functionalities through an AI-powered chat interface. By simplifying access to on-chain actions, Build Links enhances the user experience for decentralized applications.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "CANCELLED", "kyc_verified": false, "timeline_version": "V1", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": "yarotska.near", "description": "## Overview:\\\\n[Buildlink](https://buildlink.vercel.app/)  is our innovative project designed to bring the power of blockchain into everyday communication. Built on the NEAR Protocol, Build Link uses AI to create seamless, interactive on-chain experiences within a chat interface, simplifying access to blockchain features for both seasoned Web3 users and newcomers.\\\\n\\\\n## Example:\\\\nBob: \\\\\\\"I want to transfer 2 NEAR to alice.near.\\\\\\\"\\\\n\\\\nThe AI will interpret this request and generate an interactive user interface (UI) directly within the chat. With a simple click, Bob can confirm the transaction, opening a wallet modal where he can securely sign and complete the transfer. This streamlined approach eliminates the need to navigate complex Web3 interfaces, making blockchain interactions as simple as chatting.\\\\n\\\\n## On-Chain Interactions in Chat\\\\nUsers can perform a variety of on-chain operations right from the chat interface. Build Links supports:\\\\n\\\\n- NEAR Transfers \\\\u{2013} Instantly transfer NEAR tokens to other users.\\\\n- NFT Minting \\\\u{2013} Mint NFTs directly with a single command.\\\\n- Staking \\\\u{2013} Stake tokens within the chat for passive income.\\\\n- Other On-Chain Operations \\\\u{2013} Any interaction that can be executed on-chain, such as governance votes or smart contract calls\\\\n\\\\n.![https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreickdzryobxg37adrbv7ia4c7rz6hxvctea6pxlndldew6wknjzzd4](https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreickdzryobxg37adrbv7ia4c7rz6hxvctea6pxlndldew6wknjzzd4)\\\\n\\\\n## AI-Powered UI Generation\\\\nThe AI generates the necessary UI for each request, reducing user input and enhancing accessibility. Users no longer need to switch between different platforms, as the chat AI handles and processes all requests in real-time.\\\\n\\\\n## Seamless Web3-to-Web2 Transition\\\\nBuild Links integrates Web3 functionalities into a familiar Web2 chat experience. This accessibility lowers the entry barrier, making blockchain features easy to use even for those new to Web3.\\\\n\\\\n## Request for Travel Stipend:\\\\nWe are seeking assistance with flights to Bangkok, which cost approximately $350 per person. We would also greatly appreciate staying at a NEAR Hackerhouse if available. If not, we request up to $200 per person for accommodation. We are not requesting any additional funds for food or miscellaneous expenses, as we plan to cover those ourselves.\\\\n\\\\nDeparture: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam \\\\u{2192} Bangkok, Thailand\\\\n\\\\nReturn: Bangkok, Thailand \\\\u{2192} Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam\\\\n\\\\n## Estimated breakdown:\\\\nFlight cost per person: $350\\\\nAccommodation cost per person: $200\\\\nTeam size: 3 students\\\\nRequest per student: $500 (Capping according to T&C)\\\\nTotal: $1500 (We can pay $1000 for ourselves)\\\\nTotal request: $500\\\\n\\\\n## About Our Project: Frontend Flow and AI\\\\nAt Build Link, we\\\\u{2019}re passionate about making blockchain accessible and intuitive. Traditional Web3 interfaces can be complex, especially for users not familiar with decentralized technology. Our mission is to break down these barriers by creating a Web2-friendly interface where users can conduct complex blockchain operations as easily as sending a message.\\\\nExplore ours project apply to REDACTED Bangkok: https://buildlink.vercel.app/\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## About my team:\\\\nHuynh Anh: Blockchain Engineer.\\\\nAnh Tuan: Software Engineer.\\\\nVuong: FullStack Developer\\\\n\\\\nGithub : \\\\n- https://github.com/SaitamaCoderVN\\\\n- https://github.com/chauanhtuan185\\\\n- https://github.com/Lou1sVuong\\\\n\\\\n## Why We Need the Support?\\\\nAs students, we are managing most expenses on our own, but the flight costs present a challenge. This travel stipend would enable us to attend the hackathon and focus fully on building our project and contributing to the NEAR ecosystem, rather than worrying about travel logistics.\\\\n\\\\n## Conclusion:\\\\nWe are excited about the opportunity to participate in the Bangkok hackathon and continue developing on NEAR. Your support would help us cover the necessary travel costs and allow us to concentrate on our project. Thank you for considering our proposal.\\\\n\\\\nBest regards,\\\\n\\\\nTeam BuildLink\\\\n\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "3b9491e8ee7fd298fade8fe8b453db9604078de7b8534035ae1d35bb8baf58e5", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "500", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Bounty", "Hackathon", "Travel expenses"]}

{"id": 116, "body": {"name": "Travel Stipend [REDACTED] Movement - Bangkok, Nov. 2024", "summary": "We are Amira Nasri, a blockchain developer, and Walid Zaghdoudi, a cybersecurity engineer, contributing to the NEAR ecosystem. We seek a stipend to attend [REDACTED] in Bangkok, traveling from Tunisia. Our goal is to develop NEARGPTAI Dev Tools, which will integrate AI, chain abstraction, and enhanced security on the NEAR platform. This project aims to create scalable and secure tools that drive adoption and strengthen user trust. Attending this event will allow us to collaborate globally", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT", "kyc_verified": false, "timeline_version": "V1", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": "yarotska.near", "description": "**Purpose**  \\\\nI am applying for an overseas travel stipend of $2000 to attend the [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok, Thailand.\\\\n\\\\n**My Records**  \\\\nAs a blockchain developer, I have actively organized workshops to teach NEAR technology in Tunisia, helping to educate and engage the local developer community. I also organized the AI Chain Near Tunisia hackathon and participated in NEARCON 2022 on Portugal, NEARCON IRL online.\\\\n[NEARCON IRL Hackathon](https://nearcon-hackathon.devpost.com/) : [Submission (https://devpost.com/software/elaco) \\\\n[AI Chain NEAR Tunisia Hackathon \\\\n](https://taikai.network/hackbox/hackathons/ai-chain-near-tunisia?token=Q05VQK5GBHLM8C8U)\\\\n\\\\n**Travel Itinerary and Estimated Costs**  \\\\n- **Departure:** Tunis, Tunisia \\\\u{2192} Bangkok, Thailand (5th November)  \\\\n- **Return:** Bangkok, Thailand \\\\u{2192} Tunis, Tunisia (14th November)\\\\n\\\\n**Estimated Costs Breakdown** (2 prs) \\\\n- **Flights:** $1700 USD  \\\\n- **Visa and Other Costs (Accommodation, Local Transport, etc.):** $300  \\\\n- **Total Estimated Cost:** $2000 USD  \\\\n\\\\n**Project Plan**  \\\\nAt the hackathon, Walid and I will develop **NEARGPTAI Dev Tools**, an AI-based project that aligns with the event\\\\\\'s submission criteria. Our goal is to integrate AI, chain abstraction, and enhanced security on the NEAR platform, creating scalable tools that enhance user trust and drive adoption. I will update this proposal once our project is submitted.\\\\n\\\\n**Project Submission**  \\\\n[Devpost Redacted Submission \\\\n](https://devpost.com/software/neargpt-ai-tools)\\\\n\\\\nI\\\\u{2019}m excited to attend this event and would greatly appreciate your support. We look forward to connecting with the NEAR community in Bangkok!\\\\n\\\\nBest,  \\\\nAmira Nasri", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "alae.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "2000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Hackathon", "Travel expenses"]}

{"id": 120, "body": {"name": "Travel grant for ETHBangkok", "summary": "Hello! I\\\\\\'m a software developer who participated in the Redacted hackathon, where I developed an innovative proof of concept using NFC ISO14443 technology on the NEAR blockchain. The project enables users to make seamless, contactless money transfers between two mobile devices, leveraging Host Card Emulation (HCE) and NFC reader technology. Our proof of concept was successfully submitted by the hackathon deadline. This project addresses the growing demand for secure and accessible payment soluti", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT", "kyc_verified": false, "timeline_version": "V1", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": "yarotska.near", "description": "At ETHWarsaw, I developed the initial version of this project, creating a simple protocol that enabled money transfers between a mobile device and a computer using a USB NFC adapter. Since then, I significantly enhanced the project at the Redacted hackathon. I redesigned the protocol to support mobile-to-mobile transfers, introducing NFC ISO14443 compatibility and custom APDU (Application Protocol Data Unit) hexadecimal commands for secure information exchange between two phones.\\\\n\\\\nImplementing the ISO14443 protocol proved challenging, especially with limited documentation and proprietary aspects of NFC technology. For instance, achieving secure authentication between the two devices involved configuring complex hexadecimal commands, which allow the phones to authenticate and initiate data transfer securely. Overcoming these issues required extensive research and experimentation to ensure reliable and secure communications on NEAR\\\\u{2019}s blockchain.\\\\n\\\\nProposed Timeline & Milestones\\\\nMilestone 1: Complete the protocol + add FIAT transactions, summarizing insights into implementing the NFC ISO14443 standard on the NEAR chain (2 weeks).\\\\nMilestone 2: Develop and test cross-platform compatibility for Android and iOS, ensuring broader access (4 weeks).\\\\nMilestone 3: Refine security features by implementing advanced authentication measures and data encryption for increased transaction safety (3 weeks).\\\\nTeam Background\\\\nI\\\\u{2019}m an experienced software developer with a background in blockchain and IoT, and I have a deep commitment to pioneering contactless technology on NEAR. I also bring experience from other hackathons where I\\\\u{2019}ve developed similar PoCs, enabling me to iterate and build upon this innovative NFC solution effectively.\\\\n\\\\nFund Allocation\\\\nTravel and Accommodation: X% \\\\u{2013} Attendance at ETHBangkok will help showcase the project, gather community feedback, and collaborate with NEAR developers to drive further improvements.\\\\nDevelopment and Testing: 100% - X% \\\\u{2013} Resources to test and enhance platform compatibility and security, Hardware and Tools, Documentation.\\\\n\\\\nThis funding will help me not only refine the project but also share my learnings with the NEAR community, making NFC-based payments more accessible for Web3 applications and ultimately driving adoption of the NEAR protocol.\\\\n\\\\nhttps://github.com/albertoZurini/ETHWarsaw2024\\\\nhttps://github.com/albertoZurini/redacted2024/tree/master", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "743ccc68311c87ff4c608dd95fb15c6d05f4d9fed4f4d3c78d5e4fdc4d3cda2a", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "1000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Hackbox", "Travel expenses"]}
